chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark R Tratar was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Hearing scheduled 5/29/15 at 1:15 p.m. in Br. 1 to determine eligibility for Alcohol Court.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

Defendant must be in treatment every single week of his supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark R Tratar in court, in custody with attorney Scott B Rasmussen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have a stipulation to proceed today. Ct. reviewed CPR and PQWOR and heard plea of No Contest to OWI-4th, Ct. found plea(s) given FKVI, accepted plea(s), and found Def. guilty of the charge(s). Based upon his plea, the Court dismissed Count 2 and DRI Counts 3, 4 and 5.  Parties stipulated to and the Court found factual basis.  BAC was .266%.  Ct. heard from State and Defense and sentenced as follows:

S/W, probation for 3 years with terms:
10 months in the DC Jail with H/T commencing forthwith
Fine of $2400 
AODA and followthrough
VIP 
Court costs
$26 blood draw fee
36 mos revocation of DL
36 mos IIL 
83 days of presentence credit
DNA sample to be provided 
Maintain full time employment 
Absolute sobriety, no bars, taverns, beer tents, etc. 
Must be in treatment every single week of his supervision 
No operating a MV w/out a valid DL 
Return for a hearing on 5-29-15 at 1:15 to determine eligibility for Alcohol Court
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
signed by def & counsel; not signed by DA
Jury trial on May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
